data.text: Continuity Orchestrator is an open-source, self-hosted automation system designed to monitor operator check-ins and take predefined actions if the operator becomes unavailable. Think of it as a programmable continuity plan with built-in escalation.

In many scenarios — solo operators, independent professionals, researchers, journalists — there is no one watching the watcher. If something happens to you, who ensures your systems are handled, your stakeholders are notified, or your information is preserved?
Continuity Orchestrator provides a structured, automated response to that question. You check in regularly. If you stop checking in, the system escalates through configurable stages.

items: OK — Normal operation. The operator is checking in regularly.
REMIND — Deadline approaching. Reminder notifications are sent via configured channels.
PARTIAL — Limited disclosure. Some pre-configured content becomes visible.
FULL — Complete disclosure. All scheduled content is published.

data.text: The system can notify through multiple channels, all optional and operator-configured:

items: X (Twitter) — automated status posts to the operator's account
Reddit — automated status posts to the operator's subreddit
GitHub Pages — this status site, updated automatically
Privacy-first — No visitor tracking, no analytics, no cookies
Self-hosted — You control your data and your deployment
Open-source — Full source code available for inspection
Transparent automation — All automated posts are clearly identified as such
Minimal footprint — Low API usage, respectful of platform rate limits

data.text: The system runs as a scheduled GitHub Actions workflow (or locally via CLI). Each "tick" evaluates the current state against the deadline, determines if escalation is needed, and executes the appropriate notification actions. The static site is rebuilt after each state change and deployed to GitHub Pages.
Configuration is managed through a web-based admin panel or CLI, with secrets stored securely in environment variables or GitHub Actions secrets.
